website_summaries.verdict: Top-of-the-line support, shock-absorption, and fit make these inserts the most popular and effective pair you will find on today's market.
pros: Features including high-density foam construction with odor and bacteria control coating, stabilizing shape, and deep heel cup that lead to optimal results
Arch heights are color-coded for an easy match to your needs
cons: Requires a bit of wear to break them in
You have to be careful to get the right arch level for your foot structure, but once you do the results are impressive

customer_reviews.title: I didn't get the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: These looked and felt different from previous versions. I bought another pair from a local running center and compared them to those I bought from this seller on Amazon. The pictures tell the tail. I'm frankly disappointed with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I saw the price was $25.99 and bought 2 pair! Wow, I thought. What a deal. I found these to feel, fit and look differently than my previous Superfeet purchased at nearly 2x the cost. Then I paid more attention to the reviews and discovered some reviewers identified their Superfeet as fake. I wonder if that is what I got and why the cost was so low. Should have paid better attention to the reviews before I made the purchase. This has impacted my trust in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: blueemerald

customer_reviews.title: New manufacturing has ruined a once great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Green Superfeet for over ten years now. They started manufacturing them in South Korea which I discovered only after ordering a pair here on Amazon. The new manufacturing is definitely not the same and the product therefore should cost less in my opinion. To be fair, I did not wear them as I immediately returned them so I can't comment on performance. I returned them because the materials felt cheap, I could see glue, the edges were out of line, and the overall appearance looked as if I made them at home as a crafting activity.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: During those weeks I was pretty disappointed with the product
customer_reviews.text: These took a few weeks to break in fully. During those weeks I was pretty disappointed with the product. I am not anymore. After I cut them down to size they have been a great ally during my 50-60 hours on my feet every week. I am a chef and I have used many other insoles. These are the most expensive ones that I've ever used, and I'm glad I made the move. These things will outlast my shoes, and after the initial break-in period they provide the perfect amount of arch support and the perfect balance between hard and soft. I would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Bad case of Plantar fasciitis?.....save your money. This does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Working in a high school all day and coaching football has blessed me with a really bad case of Plantar fasciitis. I have tried just about everything to get healed up and when my team's PT suggested SuperFeet, I was excited to order them. They made loud noises as I walked down the hallways and my Plantar fasciitis if anything got worse. I have read where several people on Amazon reviews say these are fake SuperFeet, so if someone can point me to real SuperFeet, please remark on this review. I am at least happy that these were refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Bellevue Native

customer_reviews.title: $30 WASTED!! NOT REAL THEY ARE KNOCKOFFS!!
customer_reviews.text: NONRETURNABLE!!!! THESE ARE A KNOCK OFF VERSION OF THE REAL ONES!! DO NOT ORDER!!! DO NOT ORDER!!! Lost respect for Amazon... this is the third thing I have bought that is not the real thing :( These insoles are cheap and flimsy and a cheaper manufactured version of the real insoles! OBVIOUSLY A REASON THEY ARE NONRETURNABLE... THIS IS A SCAM! Buy them in a running or shoe store so you know what you’re getting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too large, no support, not returnable
customer_reviews.text: These insoles are paper thin, except for a small piece of plastic around the heel area. There is no arch support at all. I purchased the women’s 6-8, and they were too big to fit into an 8.5 women’s shoe. I didn’t cut them beforehand, so that I’d be able to return them if they didn’t work out. Joke was on me though, because these aren’t returnable anyway, even though the purchase screen clearly states they’re eligible for free returns. Not true, and I’m stuck with $50 insoles that aren’t the correct size and have no arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I went online to the superfeet website and took “the test” to find out which color was the best one to fit my needs. I got green. I ordered them from Amazon because of my history and trust with Amazon. When I got them - I put them in my shoes and tried them for about 5 days - I couldn’t stand it. The pain in my feet was intense. I could hardly walk. I read some more reviews and ordered another color only that works much better. But severely disappointed that I’m stuck with a pair that’s useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: shehunts1175

customer_reviews.title: ***WARNING***
customer_reviews.text: The fit was okay but the quality was not there. And... YOU CANNOT RETURN THESE!!! It says prime members free returns but they still won't let you. I called customer service and explained my frustration because they were never worn and NOT WORTH THE PRICE. They said they would give me a one time exception. THEY ARE GIVING ME A ONE TIME EXCEPTION!? FOR THEIR FALSE ADVERTISING!! Amazon disappointed me this time. I would NOT RECOMMEND this product because 1) quality is not worth the price and 2) if you decide to see for yourself and realize number 1, you won't be able to return them without a fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fake, confirmed by podiatrist
customer_reviews.text: I am a podiatrist so I know my insoles very well. I have been using superfeet for myself and patients for almost ten years. I received a pair that looked different than the ones that I’ve purchased in the past. These are clearly a knock off version with no arch support and if worn these will cause joint pain and possible damage. Do not purchase these- I unfortunately missed the return window due to a shipping error. I paid full price, $49.99 and still received a fake pair. Very disappointing of amazon and the superfeet store as a long-time client.
customer_reviews.author: Puggle lover

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are extremely uncomfortable and add little to no comfort or endurance to my feet. You would probably be better off with cardboard inserts. I wouldnt have left such a negative review if I could return them but guess what? They are eligible for return! Its almost like they new they are selling absolute crap and dont want you to be able to get your money back. I normally wear 7.5W in my boots, work shoes, and personal shoes. The 7.5-9 size was not wide enough in the arch and it felt like I was wearing high heels.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Work great but not recommended for anything over size 12
customer_reviews.text: These inserts were actually shorter than the inserts in my size 12 timberland boots. They are advertised as size men's 11.5 - 13 If they were any shorter I would have sent them back. I trimmed a small amount off the curves on the sides. Despite being a little shorter they fit just fine and are extremely comfortable. I love the arch support and like how stiff they are on the heel. Great product that will hopefully Last 1 year or 500 miles of walking as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jer Has AkA Bear AkA NaturallyCali

customer_reviews.title: Work better than my $390 custom orthotics !
customer_reviews.text: Trimmed for a perfect fit. Simply remove the current insole, use it as a pattern,trim with common scissors. I have plantar fasciitis in both feet. These feel better than the $390 custom orthotics I wasted money on plus the $600 in fees the Podiatrist charged. Have only walked on them for 5 days but the constant pain has eased up some already. I am back to walking everyday with my Rottie ! These insoles have very good arch support, and nice cushioning for the heel and metatarsal area. Will be ordering several more pairs for all my shoes. I have been telling everyone about these.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Arch pain no more!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to make my wide array of flat soled Converse shoes actually wearable for any period of time. On the first wear they seem hard and like they wont be comfortable, I was disappointed initially BUT after a day or two they break in, form to your feet and feel great. Perfect if you have high arches and need that support. I can now wear "flat sole" shoes day after day for 8-12 hours at a time with zero foot pain or issues. I've used them for a year now and they still feel fantastic. I did have to trim a little off the top edges to customize the fit for the particular shoe, but thats to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: CyborgBetty

customer_reviews.title: Superfeet plus metatarsal pads
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches and have pain on the ball of my foot so I added some metatarsal pads to these Green Superfeet and now it's perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 running shoe. I bought a specific pair of shoes for the color for a special event; however, I overpronate on my left and supinate on my right and needed much more supportive insoles than those shoes provided. These insoles are great! My feet feel supported. Good arch support and keeps the weight evenly distributed on throughout my feet (heel, arch, toe mound, and side to side) which keeps my feet, knees, and hips from hurting when I run. The price is great when compared to custom orthotics. Sure, it's more expensive than Dr.Scholls in the pharmacy at WalMart, but this is a type of product that price reflects the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Heal your feet
customer_reviews.text: When you first purchase these your feet will still hurt for a while. Keep using them the pain will go away and if you let your feet get really bad before you went to the doctor and he told you to purchase these....wear you shoes inside too. Don’t go anywhere without these until your feet feel better. If your feet don’t feel better after two weeks. See your doctor you most like have something he needs to look at.
customer_reviews.author: SmilingJack

customer_reviews.title: Great Insoles
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how well these fit. I've worn custom made orthotics for decades and couldn't believe when my podiatrist said I could order them on Amazon. They were easy to adjust to so must have been similar to my custom ones which cost many times more than these did. So far they're doing good. Will be interesting to see how well they hold up. And of course being from Seattle the bright green color is perfect. Got them in 2 days and they were just as described.
customer_reviews.author: frogbilli

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable, Size Up For A More Forward Arch
customer_reviews.text: Definitely do what some have suggested and if you are at the higher end on the suggested shoe size range, then size up. The arch will lie too far back if you don't. I cut the inserts about half a centimeter wider than the removable inserts for my rain boots and they fit great! It's also a perfect solution to make your shoes slightly more snug, especially if you are a half size and the shoes only come in full sizes.
customer_reviews.author: lizzy keiger

customer_reviews.title: On sale, these are the best support insoles you can buy..
customer_reviews.text: First few days were annoying. I was going to contact customer support. Stuck in there for another week, and pain started subsiding. I am on my feet for the entire work day, so there was still SOME pain and fatigue, but I've got a messed up foot, so it's all good. Do not plan on using this in multiple different pairs of shoes, often. Switching them in and out often will cause them to fall a part, a claim made by the company and confirmed by me! It's all good if you switch them every once in a while, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the company doesn't stand behind their products and offer ...
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from multiple issues with my left foot and rely on inserts to keep me pain-free whilst walking. At the recommendation of a friend, I bought the inserts to check them out for comfort. They went into my shoes okay, but after extended use I found my feet were in more pain than I have ever had before using Dr. Scholles inserts. While I understand the reason, I don't like the company doesn't stand behind their products and offer a 30-day satisfaction guarantee. I'm extremely dissatisfied and will not be purchasing products from this company again. Superfeet does NOT equate to Happy Feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bartleson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first I am still wearing in my athletic shoes. I am still wearing them after a year of wear. Love them for walking my 3 miles a day. The second pair I will be using for my everyday shoes so I don't have to switch back and forth. Buyer should know the original sole in the pair you will be putting them in must be removed first.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Shoe size doesn't mean correct arch fit
customer_reviews.text: Arch does not hit in the right place. I needed a bigger size, not to fit my shoe but to correctly fit my arch. Do to the arch being in the wrong place it caused my toes to cramp while walking long distances. Superfeet needs to give more details about correct fit. I went to a store that sold/ fit superfeet and was fitted into a larger size that needed to be cut down to fit my shoes and they are working out much better.
customer_reviews.author: K. Taber

customer_reviews.title: I received counterfeit superfeet insoles
customer_reviews.text: Superfeet customer service informed me that the insoles I received from my amazon order with counterfeit. Others have pointed this out as well. The fabric ion the surface is one indication (left to right, rather than heel to toe striations are NOT legit superfeet). Another is the quality of the plastic base. Of about 6 pairs I've owned, the one pair I got from amazon cracked. Check your order and write to amazon so they can removed sellers turning counterfeits on this platform. Such a pervasive problem.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Love-hate relationship
customer_reviews.text: These insoles hurt at first, especially if you usually wear flats, or other garbage shoes like cheap flip-flops which have damaged your arches. However my doctor had me get these since I tore my post-tibial tendon and I needed a huge amount of arch support. That was about 9 years ago. Sadly lost one shoe from my checked bag in a trans-continental flight. Worth buying again as I did recently. I put them in my treasured Chucks and now they don't hurt my feet or cause my old injury to flare up if I go for a long walk.
customer_reviews.author: Strawberry_Toast

customer_reviews.title: Great insole
customer_reviews.text: The best insole I have ever owned. I stand and I'm on my feet all day-to-day these are the only insoles to wear in any shoe or boot. I have bought all the other brands and none of them have ever helped my feet. This is my third pair because I got tired of moving then around from my work shoes to my hiking boots to my sneakers. This insole offers the best arch support and my feet don't hurt at all at the end of the day. They did take some getting used to because they aren't that squishy gel insole that you would expect. They are a hard foam base with a plastic arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Tin T. Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Great orthotic for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I first started using Superfeet insoles in our golf shoes around 10 or more years ago. In most shoes we remove the insole from the shoe and replace it with the Superfeet insole. This give us more room in the toe area that helps minimize pain in the big toe joint. That is my reason for using them. But my husband has also purchased these for his slippers and work shoes. He used to have an extremely expensive orthotic that was made specifically for him. But he has found this Superfeet insole works better in providing arch support and alleviating foot pain in his arch.
customer_reviews.author: FJLTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: Insoles are absolutely amazing for my feet. This is my 3rd pair I have bought. Bought a pair for my son he is on his feet a lot as well. He tried them and likes them as well. It is a good arch support. Probably not so good for flat feet. Another family member who has flat feet did not care for them and complained of them hurting. But he only wore them 5 minutes and said no! At first they do feel weird. But I hadn't had any feet problems since I've been using them and I started with them back in 2002 After a long bout of plantar fascia to which these helped to alleviate the pain.
customer_reviews.author: claudia p.

customer_reviews.title: add to shoes that are roomy to start with
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smaller size in the hope I wouldn't need to trim the outside of the insoles. That was a good idea in this case since my shoe size borders the two sizes available. The shoes were my size but fit a bit loose when worn. When I put the insoles in the shoes my feet felt a little tight in the shoes until I wore them for a day. That little bit of wear stretched the shoes enough where its now snug fit but not uncomfortable. That said if your shoes fit snug before you add the insoles, you won't be able to wear the shoes after you insert the insoles into the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Holden

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for me!
customer_reviews.text: I had lots of ankle and foot pains. So I went to my Podiatrist. He saw I have pretty flat feet and recommended these Green ones. I went home and ordered them from amazon. They arrived 2 days later. They slide snuggly and perfectly into my regular shoes I love to wear. They felt comfortable to walk in. I felt some aches in my leg and butt muscles after wearing them for a few days but my doctor had warned me of this. Those aches disappeared in a few days. I now notice that my ankle and foot pains have also disappeared. I’ve been wearing them now for over a month and I’m still pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Dianelynne

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price, Not Sure Why the Hype
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find these insoles any more supportive than less expensive brands here on Amazon. I suggest trying one of the less expensive but well reviewed brands. I went with Walk Hero and enjoy them:
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Knock-offs
customer_reviews.text: These are not brand-name Superfeet insoles. I could have saved myself the trouble by pulling my insoles out of my shoes and comparing them with the product photos before ordering, but I didn't. Comparison photos are attached; these insoles are on the left and the real Superfeet insoles I purchased from a local running store are on the right.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: These support the arches and are not for comfort
customer_reviews.text: These are more of an orthotic shoe insert - for people who need real adjustment in the shape of their feet, not for people just looking for cushion or comfort. It takes time to break them in and they will definitely feel "hard" while you're getting used to it. I can't comment on how they improve pain yet. I wish they came in different sizes so that I wouldn't have to cut them to size.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect arch support; pay up.
customer_reviews.text: The best insoles. I used to have major pain in my arches pretty often, sometimes very intense, disruptive. Then I found these. Perhaps a coincidence, but although I’m older than ever, I never suffer foot/arch pain anymore. If you’re new to them, they might feel weird for a while, really weird at first. I remember that, but stick with it a while and see... After twenty years, I now put them in all my shoes except Chacos. Many hundreds of $$ well-spent. Invest in your feet. Not cheap considering the low cost of materials, and yet somehow worth it because of the performance. Perfection.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: However they do lift your heals like half an inch
customer_reviews.text: They are decent. A bit overpriced I think. I have to be on my feet at work for 8 hours straight doing retail and it does relieve some of the pain. However they do lift your heals like half an inch, so you need to have shoes with a high enough back. I bought a new pair of shoes that I wanted to wear these with, but my heel sticks up way to far and that is quite unsatisfying. So I have to put them in my ratty old shoes for work.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these before but I’m pretty sure I got ripped off this time. They usually last me 6 months, these lasted less then 3 wks and they’re already hurting my feet! After reading other reviews Maybe I bought the wrong insole and my feet have changed in the last 6 months and I should have bought the Orange superfeet instead, IDK
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not high enough for my arches
customer_reviews.text: These are well built and probably will work well for people with medium arches but not high arches. I have extreme supination of my feet and have very high arches. I instead opted to go with the Icebug Slim High Arch for my sneakers and am also using the Icebug Fat High Arch for my workboots. They fit me much better and I can feel the support. Also, the icebugs have a metatarsal bump that is just fantastic. The arches are also higher and the material slightly more cushiony but about the same. Try both and see what works for you.
customer_reviews.author: H. H.

customer_reviews.title: Been using Superfeet for years
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are built for an average foot... no one has an average foot... I work all day on a hard concrete floor and these help make it bearable... The arch is a tad higher than "stock" so it takes a day or so to get used to, but I would never have a shoe without them. Use them in my hiking boots too. Recent set for a pair of Salomon XA Pros
customer_reviews.author: Exeter_acres

customer_reviews.title: Works for some foot types and injuries
customer_reviews.text: Doctor recommended these for me rather than their $500 custom insoles. I had small tears in my Achilles’ tendon. After injections she recommended these. For those who say these don’t help, SEE A DOCTOR. You may have a different condition than these are made for. I have high arches naturally, and hurt my foot. I have now bought about 8 of these. They last me around 90 days of everyday use. I buy two pair at a time and put in my work boots and walking shoes. I rotate then across those shoes first week of the month so I get more even wear. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Short

customer_reviews.title: Odd arch placement defect? Not returnable
customer_reviews.text: The insole itself is long enough for a women's size 10, but the arch is pushed way back toward the heel like it's fit for a size 7-8. And it's all hard plastic, no real foam for support. Idk if this normal or a defect because walking on a plastic flipper is no-go for $50. Very uncomfortable. If you need to return, go to the customer service contact page and speak with a rep. in a chat window or on the phone. It's unacceptable that certain sizes are eligible for return and even prime wardrobe, but I can't return a new, unworn size that is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Samanthadoodles

customer_reviews.title: They do what they are supposed to do......
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear the Blue Superfeet but the green were on sale & the description said they offered maximum support with a deep heel cut for shock absorption. So I decided to try them. I prefer the Blue ones. These have a high arch support which, if you have arch issues, may be better for you. But it wasn't comfortable for me. I normally walk 5-8 miles per day minimum and my feet were just uncomfortable after a few days of these (I assumed there would be a period of time for me to get used to them but they just didn't work). I'll go back to the Blue ones.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but work UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Felt great, worked well for 7 months. Maybe I expect to much for $50. I will just buy a new pair of boots. UPDATE, after looking at the company’s projected life span (500 miles) of the green insoles along with my step counter app I calculated that the insoles I purchased made it to 500 miles as claimed. Good Job! If you calculate this yourself remember to calculate a mile by number of steps and not number of feet in a mile. I am 5’9” and my step count per mile is 2,211 steps per mile. Based on this information I did purchase another pair and installed them. Happy I Did! Happy Travels
customer_reviews.author: Lucky1

customer_reviews.title: Good, quality shoe inserts. These are my 3 pair over the years
customer_reviews.text: These are insoles as long as they’re the real thing. Many items I’m purchasing on Amazon aren’t real these days and it’s starting to really bother me. Anyway, this time I bought a pair of Superfeet for my ongoing plantars fasciitis, but these did not work for that at all, I needed something softer and more protective. (My plantars fasciitis has gotten really bad though, so maybe they’d work for the beginning cases of plantar fasciitis). I’ve used Superfeet many times in the past and they’re good, quality inserts outside of custom made ones. They last a long time and support your feet. Definitely worth spending a little more for these, and they’re even less than what others go for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Prefontaine

customer_reviews.title: Loud annoying noise!
customer_reviews.text: I was prescribed these exact insoles by my doctor because I have flat feet, and a partially torn ligament and tendon in my ankle. These insoles worked fine for about a week and now they squeak in my shoes! I have used several pairs of these over the years and it seems like 75% of the insoles I have bought of this exact brand and color squeak. I have only had two pairs that didn’t squeak. I’m tired of spending nearly $50 for insoles that make a loud noise every step I take. I found another brand that works well for me now that doesn’t make noise. I will never buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: gavin

customer_reviews.title: So far, pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Superfeet Green Heritage insoles with much trepidation as the cost was about 30% of what I paid for my Brooks running shoes. The shoe's original insoles had worn after a few years and a lot of miles but the outsides were in excellent shape, so I thought I'd give these a try. They fit with no cutting into my 8 1/2 men's shoes and gave me excellent arch support. I am still if the early accommodation period and am waiting a few more days for final judgement. Except for some (hopefully initial) soreness, these are very comfortable. If, once they're shaped to my foot, all the soreness goes away, I'll give these a 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: When I got these it looked like they had already been used. I trimmed and put in my shoes. My feet hurt all day. I could not wait to get home and take them out! Very disappointed. They were too expensive to hate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who has arches on both sides of each foot?
customer_reviews.text: Super feet in the 1990s and early 2000’s were peerless. I used them in snowboard boots and athletic trainers. But now, their new lasts feature an outside arch toward the heel. Uncomfortable and not designed for my feet. My foot arches are on the inside. Who are these people who have a Second set of arches on the outside of their feet? And why is Superfeet catering to them?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective insert
customer_reviews.text: I always wear super feet as my shoe insert because they help support my arches. However, I am disappointed with the ones I ordered in January, as one of the inserts split in half and moreover being a few months old- perhaps a defect? I couldn't find the company to reach out to. Hopefully they will see this review and reach out to me:) The Judge
customer_reviews.author: The Judge

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Not eligible for return!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in the women's size 8.5-10. My shoe size is a ten, and the insole is too short. I had planned to send it back and order the larger size, but when I clicked on the return button, I got a message saying the item is not eligible for return!! I just threw away FIFTY DOLLARS!!!! I am shocked and disappointed. Please, do yourself a favor and choose an insole that can be returned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great
customer_reviews.text: For a $50 pair of inserts you would expect more than a $9 pair of Dr scholls. The reviews were that they are great etc but for me they fit ok but they had poor arch support. The arch was too far back and very low. Durability was good though. As for support and comfort, they were about the same as cheaper brands (aside from the aforementioned arch issue). Overall, while good, they were not worth the $50.
customer_reviews.author: Keeping Rational

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - not cheap but well worth investment in your feet!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased 2 pairs of these in 2008 and they are just now showing signs of wear in the top of the heels. The base is just as good as the day they were purchased. They have out lasted two pair of 1105 New Balance shoes which NB/Hitchcock no longer make. I just purchased several more of these to outfit all my shoes. For a big man with some feet sensitivity issues, these provide a very firm stable base that I like. I wear 12 6E and these are a perfect fit with no trimming whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: JPSilver

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit like they used to, something has changed in their sizibng
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Superfeet for 15+ years, always bought the green ones in XL size. Previous insoles always fit great in all of my shoes. The latest ones that I bought about 2 months ago are much smaller in the heel cup and in the arch support. They do not stay in place inside of my shoes and are quite uncomfortable. I thought perhaps they just needed to be broken-in (although previous ones did not need break-in) but even after 2 months they are uncomfortable. I don't know what/why Superfeet changed the sizing, but I guess I'll have to switch to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: MtnYankee

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why I didn't try these sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic plantar fasciitis, and I suffer from tendentious in my ankles. Since being at home during the covid pandemic I've been taking a lot of hikes, and have been having issues since the beginning with pain. I was about to schedule an appointment with a podiatrist, when I saw these and figured what the heck let's give them a try. I only had to trim them a little because I have pretty big feet. But let me tell you, my sneakers were infinitesimally more comfortable and I had no pain in my ankles or my feet. I would recommend using these, and I see myself buying another pair when I need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Creedon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Foot Over Pronation!
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought that I had made the wrong decision because the first day that I had worn them, it didn't help with the over pronation of my right foot caused by my flat feet. But my massage teacher told me that sometimes shoe inserts have to be broken in, and to continue to wear them for a couple of days and I should start to feel a difference, and I did. They are very comfortable and they have been extremely supportive as far as my foot over pronating.
customer_reviews.author: Lightworker 11

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these for running shoes. Have used the green superfeet for years. These were terrible. They made my feet hurt terribly and had to put in the old ones. Now I'm stuck with three pairs--trimmed to fit my shoe. It's hard to describe how they made my feet feel but it was painful and triggered plantar fascitiis pain that is usually improved with orthodics.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeBike

customer_reviews.title: Helps for plantar faciitis
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had plantar faciitis for a long time, it was horrible. Went to a podiatrist and was told they could make me a custom orthotic, or I could get this insert instead and have the same results. I tried it then and it worked and then stopped using them when the pain went away. It recently returned so I bought them again and within 2 weeks the pain had gone away, so I consider that a huge win!
customer_reviews.author: Terp

customer_reviews.title: Professional-Grade High Arch Orthotic Insert
customer_reviews.text: These orthotic inserts were delivered on time, fit well after I trimmed them and as you can see I only gave them a 4 stars instead of 5 stars. The reason being is because after wearing them for a week they began to smell I do not like smelly feet. But it does serve the purpose. Wish I could do something about the smell. Thanks, Abuelita
customer_reviews.author: Abuelita

customer_reviews.title: Great for High Arches
customer_reviews.text: I love the Superfeet Green insoles. I have extremely high arches, and these really help combat my plantar fasciitis when I run long distances. I have been running for several years now, and I have been wearing these in whatever running shoes I am wearing at that point in time. They are not soft insoles. They are rather hard, but I feel that they really help hold my arches up as I run several miles at a time. I would recommend these to people with high arches, runners, or even people who feel they just need more arch support. I will continue to wear these!
customer_reviews.author: KAT

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly, feel great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these, feel great on my feet after a couple days. Initially didn't even have to trim them, they just fit into my size 11.5 Nikes (This particular pair fits more like a 10.5 though, for the record). Did trim them after a day when I noticed an audible squeak. Trimming them didn't fix the squeak and now I just live with it, my girlfriend says it sounds kind of like I have a duck following me. The internet suggests putting packing tape on the bottoms or scuffing up the plastic with some sandpaper to reduce squeaking. So comfortable that I forgot to take these shoes off after my workout and I'm wearing them right now.
customer_reviews.author: BMcSherry

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit the same as before
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these insoles (brand, size, and support level) for 10+ years in my hiking boots and trainers. I have always been very happy with them but this time they aren't fitting as well as they did before. My older ones have been great but my new ones hurt my feet. Maybe they changed something in their manufacturing? I might have to start looking for a new brand, especially for in my trainers.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rether

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long days on feet, like my other Superfeet insoles
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple pairs of super feet insoles and these just didn't cut it for me! i wish there was a way to return them after usage because i would, or at least trade them back in for another pair that might work better for my needs. I didn't know that the different colors of insole were specific for certain fit or need of comfort. I usually purchase the dark blue or black ones at a store called REI (i'm color blind) but i couldn't find them so I bought the green pair from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: AtheyMts

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Got someone’s used insoles. Thankfully they weren’t disgusting, but clearly someone had trimmed them already. No original packaging so I have no idea if I got real ones or knock-offs. Either way, very disappointed and returned same day.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky but they work.
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars if they did not squeak so loud! This is not new... my first pair from many years ago, and every pair since, have done the same thing. Supports my arches great. Just went to 4 days of a PGA Tournament and walked a ton of miles on them and my damaged feet, legs and back felt better than with my sneakers old insoles. Had to stand real still when I was near players getting ready to hit the ball though... That dang squeaking!
customer_reviews.author: KJHishere

customer_reviews.title: I love these but..
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was weird that I got these not in original packaging. It was returned and then sold to me as new. That is wrong. I shouldve gotten a discount! Although they appeared to be “new” it shouldve been my choice if I wanted open box!
customer_reviews.author: Mineralminer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review on behalf of my husband who has plantar fasciitis, which if you have ever experienced it is an incredibly painful foot condition. My husband literally walks miles during his work day and he was in severe pain. His physical therapist recommended these insoles. While they are not miracle workers and do not remove all of the pain (that would be an unrealistic expectation of any insole) they certainly have reduced his pain. He noticed an improvement immediately. He gives them a thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe @ blessed and bewildered

customer_reviews.title: The answer to the problem you didn't know you had
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to running, I discovered I had high arches. Most shoes and boots have zero to little support. It's mind boggling, really. I was having problems with my left knee many years ago a few months into taking up running and stumbled across an online article about proper support in shoes. It took some time to figure out what I needed but needless to say that Superfeet support insoles are in every pair of shoes that I own. It takes some time getting used to them, but once you go green you'll never be seen without them. :D
customer_reviews.author: dreamer_rt

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVERS
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and my pronation finally took its toll on my left foot after a long day in a pair of Chucks. I could barely walk in any shoe, and barefoot was out of the question completely. My orthopedic surgeon recommended Superfeet greenies and these insoles saved my life. I have always been an avid weightlifter and sometimes-crossfitter, and these got me back in the gym within a few weeks of wear (and in-home physical therapy). I wear them in every shoe I own and after six months I can walk barefoot around the house again. I wish I had something like these playing sports growing up!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing for me
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before ordering these, and hoped these footbed inserts would help alleviate my foot pain, brought on whenever I had to spend a whole day pretty much on my feet the whole time. These footbeds did not feel very cushiony, and did not have any effect. I gave them a good try in different pairs of shoes for several weeks. They just didn't do anything for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cuyamungue

customer_reviews.title: Best insoles I’ve ever run in.
customer_reviews.text: Superfeet insoles are one of the best “over-the-counter” orthotics you can buy. I recommend the green ones for high arches and the blue for everyone else. They are firm anatomically molded and provide support and control. Great for plantar fasciitis. They last a long time too. I have a blue pair that are over 5 years old and have rotated them out from my running shoes to my winter boots.
customer_reviews.author: MotoMikeRyder

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have my Superfeet!
customer_reviews.text: There should be a law against the cheap, flimsy insoles that shoemakers put in their shoes. If you have any issues with pronation; ankle, knee or hip injury; or just need more support for long hours on your feet, Superfeet are the first insole you should try. I've tried others, including expensive custom inserts and cheaper drugstore inserts, but I always come back to green Superfeet. I have them in dress and casual shoes, hiking boots, motion control running shoes, and ski boots, so I'm not going anywhere without my Superfeet!
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the Walk Heroes. Those are great inserts. I wanted to try these to see if they would last longer. The support is supposed to be "rigid" vs "semi-rigid" vs the Walk Heroes. I don't think these are any better than the walk Heroes and will stay with them after this purchase. I see some reviewers complain of items being delivered that did not match the images from the seller. I did not have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: ARH

customer_reviews.title: Really funky arch positioning
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately these were a miss with my feet. I have decently high arches the arch support of these insoles ended up being way too far back toward my heel, rendering these pretty much unwearable for more than a mile or two. Maybe I have a weird foot layout, but I've never had these issues with other arch-specific insoles. Was hoping for more with this kind of investment.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Scholl's never went to school.
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended these. I thought $50 was a lot Compared to the cheap dr. Scholl's once I've always seen at a pharmacy. I've been diagnosed with plantar fasciitis and after trying these out I noticed an improvement the very first day. I would definitely recommend to anyone with plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but a bit overpriced. Arch support too stiff.
customer_reviews.text: They are advertised as high-profile insoles (i.e. for people with high arches), and they are not kidding. I have medium profile arches and although they are wearable, it's not the most comfortable experience. However, the main reason I'm knocking a star is because they are a bit overpriced for what they offer. Granted, they are a quality product, but you can find similarly built options from Dr. Scholls at half the price. Also, the arch support feels too rigid, ideally it should have some "give" to it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Difference! AND LESS PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them in my work boots for about four days, but these Superfeet Green Premium Insoles are AWESOME!!! You see at 65 I have a no cartilage left in my left ankle (as diagnosed by a top podiatrist here in the Jacksonville, FL area) and I have neuropathy in 80% of my right foot and I'm on my feet at a big box store for 9 hours a day! My previous insoles worked well for almost two years but needed replacing. These Superfeet reduced the amount of pain I was feeling by a significant amount! I am amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Crafty12player

customer_reviews.title: Supportive, but needs some cushion too.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were good, so I thought I would try them. I tried them yesterday and my feet began to hurt AFTER I put them in my shoes. My feet started the day well, ended badly. Not for me, I think they have support, but not enough cushion to go with it. Too hard on top of the support, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Trotta

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis in my right foot. I’ve bought another brand insert and it hardly made a difference. After replacing them with Superfeet Green I’ve noticed a great improvement. It have really helped reduce my pain. It feels like the insert is distributing the weight on my foot throughout the shoe. I’ve only had them a couple weeks but I’m very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie  Collins

customer_reviews.title: Over the top surprised at how much they helped me.
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended these after a conversation where I admitted to having back pain after standing for any length of time. They arrived, I removed the insoles in my shoes and compared them to the Superfeet for fit. I didn't need to cut or trim them at all. The best part is that after wearing them for one day I was amazed that the discomfort in my back was not there. I love these things and would recommend them to anyone although the results could be different than what I experienced. I will definitely be making additional purchases so that I will not need to be removing and replacing them from one pair of shoes to another.
customer_reviews.author: PBW

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for a hospital workers feet
customer_reviews.text: I am used to goodfeet inserts for my work sneakers. I am a hospital worker and am on my feet for 13+ hours a day. I looked up the next best thing besides goodfeet inserts and found these. They did absolute nothing for me. They do not have any arch support what so ever. I even wore for months to break in and they still hurt worse than just wearing my sneaker inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Britta Wickles

customer_reviews.title: Work and fit well.
customer_reviews.text: Local store recommended these for high arch feet. I have a bad case of Planters and went through therapy. Comfortable right out of the box and you can feel the support. Purchased on Amazon and saved $10.00 from what the large sporting goods store was charging. It did not specify on the box but yes you remove your existing insoles and replace them with these. Don't just pop them in your sneakers without first removing the factory insoles.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Aftermarket Insole Out There!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other brands, and end up always coming back to Superfeet. I’ve been using them initially in my ski boots before there custom heat formed insoles. Then, I started using them in my hiking boots, and my work boots. I have a high arch and the support they offer and help fill in the heel cup, so I get a good grab to keep my feet comfortable. These greatly lessen the fatigue I feel after a long day on my feet are beyond compare.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Lumovic

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these
customer_reviews.text: Cracked under normal usage, insoles are too small width wise and rubbed my medical arches raw.
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, even cheap drug store brands are better.
customer_reviews.text: Does literally zero for support or pain relief. At over $50 a pair I expected SOMETHING but these are not only wafer thin, but offer zero arch support and the top fabric is already separating off the top. No cushioning, nothing. Also assumed because their other insoles were returnable these were too. Nope. $50 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I am an outlier but I am not a fan of these, particularly at $40 a pop. They did not help my plantar fasciitis at all. I have very high arches and I didn’t feel like the support in this was high enough for me, despite them being advertised as for high arches. Second, they have almost zero padding, which I found uncomfortable. Lastly, as they are not sized to fit, I had to trim these to fit my size 12s, and was harder than it sounds. PSA: take your time and err on the side of under trimming when cutting to size.
customer_reviews.author: T Walker

customer_reviews.title: Make my shoes comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST insoles I have found. I have Plantar Fasciitis and have a hard time walking very far without pain in my feet or legs. I have a very high arch and as I am aging, my feet and legs become sore when walking. With these insoles and using compression socks, I have been able to walk 5-6 miles without any discomfort or blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Amazon. Get from a real store
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that this is crap. The green plastic part is firm, but the foam part is so painful. Basically no sole, so trying to live a day in these, is insane. I'd rather be without shoes than use these insoles. I tried these for several months before I tossed them. It felt like walking on cheap plastic and a cardboard box... Save your money. Get the real product. It's probably better. Wish I could return these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Fox

customer_reviews.title: Why do they squeak?
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for two weeks now. It seems that the squeaking gets louder. It becomes embarrassing walking in them as the squeaking is pretty loud. Now some people are saying they got fakes so wondering if I did. I’ve used other insoles and none of them squeaked as badly as these. It is somewhat comfortable though so that I’m happy about. I’m just disappointed how loud it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mirage241

customer_reviews.title: Weird placement of arch support
customer_reviews.text: The insole was long enough for my foot (women's 10), but the arch support was so far back toward my heel that there was a huge gap between my arch and the insole. Unfortunately, they're not eligible for return, so I'm out $50, still with no insoles to help my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: parwith

customer_reviews.title: These were super for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I had planters fasciitis and Achilles tendonitis. My dogs were barkin. Doctors are recommending these things over custom orthotics. I've been trying different types of inserts and these are great. They are for medium to high arches so if your flat footed it takes some time to get used to the arch support these provide. You will also need some extra space in your shoes to fit these inserts even of you remove the original inserts especially with slip on type shoes. They worked for me, my feet hurt much less and I can walk in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Witzel

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: A couple of years ago my podiatrist recommended Superfeet for my plantar fasciitis after traditional treatment was less than successful. From day one the pain disappeared and I can walk miles with no discomfort. I've taken out factory insoles from all my shoes and insert Superfeet arch supports. The last for 1 1/2 to 2 years so I have a couple of pair and rotate them extending useful life. Superfeet is far superior to other products of its kind and I highly recommend the green version.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Aro

customer_reviews.title: The best Orthotic device short of custom made
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these to replace a very worn pair of the same kind from about 15 years ago. I saw a sport doctor who recommended them and they have worked well for many years. I haven't used these yet, waiting to buy a new pair of tennis shoes for them, since I will have to cut them to fit, but it was easy the first time so I'm sure it will busy this time too. I highly recommend these to anyone needing a good pair of insoles. Very comfortable and supportive and can be removed for use in other shoes too.
customer_reviews.author: Kiya05

customer_reviews.title: This hurts my feet more than it helped. There is no refund.
customer_reviews.text: The arch is too high, I tried to return it for a pair with lower arc support but they don't allow refund. Wasted $50. This site should allow 0 stars. Better to buy this from a store so you can return it if they are the wrong size for you.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Fit for my Feet
customer_reviews.text: I normally use Vasylli orthotics which I find fit my feet perfectly. The arch on these is molded too far back so it presses too much into my heel and is uncomfortable. Unfortunately to try them you have to cut them down to size at the toe (this is normal for an over the counter orthotic) which I assume makes them unreturnable so now I own them. I know a lot of people like them but for me I wouldn't buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: TimPT

customer_reviews.title: These Live in my Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I purchased these to go into my work shoes, but shortly after I received these, I switched into a much less "on-your-feet" job. I stuck them in my hiking boots and I can go for hours up and down all sorts of terrain. Mind you, my hiking boots are diamonds on their own, but these are well worth the money to add a good amount of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by a podiatrist
customer_reviews.text: A podiatrist recommended these instead of the Dr School I was using. This model offers more support for the arch. It takes a few days to get used to them, but after that I don’t think I’ll go back to Dr School.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I could really tell the difference at the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly, this was not a case where the product felt way more comfortable than cheaper inserts while I was walking. The difference was how my joints felt that night and the next day. I could feel a very pronounced difference there. These are superior to any of the other orthopedic inserts I have tried so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Wicks

customer_reviews.title: A good choice, but not my first choice
customer_reviews.text: I compared these side-by-side with SF Orange insoles and chose the Orange model. It is more expensive, yes, but it is designed with full foam cushioning throughout the entire length of the insole. The forefoot is especially well padded in the Orange model. Both are for high arches. I prefer the Orange because I'm very active (tennis, walking, jogging).
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by my orthopedist when I started to have pain in my feet. They fit in perfectly into my sketchers size 9 shoes, no cutting required! These worked so well I bought another pair for my work shoes. I was able to break them in around the house for a few hours at a time now I can wear them 8-9 hours straight with no pain.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Great support for the value versus custom inserts.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Superfeet insoles for over 12 years in my work boots on a factory floor. I got pairs for teenagers to insert into their "cool looking" shoes without supporting insoles. These are better value than getting custom made expensive inserts made. I will buy some more of these inserts in the future for myself and other people.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Everyone kept telling me that superfeet would be the answer for my foot issues. I was diagnosed with PF and tarsal tunnel syndrome which is mechanical in nature. I need to prevent the probation and Several sales people and a physical therapist convinced to to try them. Unfortunately they did nothing but make the problem worse. Within ten minutes I was in such extreme pain I could not walk. I’m sure they work well for others, but I do not think they are suitable for those suffering from TTS.
customer_reviews.author: PJTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: Superfeet GREEN Insoles, Professional-Grade High Arch Support, Orthotic Shoe Inserts for Maximum Support, Unisex, Green
feature_bullets: EVOLYTE carbon fiber stabilizer cap responds to compression, springing back to its original shape
AEROSPRING Dual Comfort foam, with extra cush per stride—taking a thumping so your feet don’t have to
Impact pad disperses impact for an easier ride
Heel cup cradles soft tissue to help absorb impact and reduce fatigue
Advanced MOISTUREWICK with Odor Control to keep your running shoes fresh
